inventory.commentary: Note: Perhaps an additional separate sense not cited by WordNet which means 'behave' and is intransitive, e.g. 'Mary performs well under pressure' and 'these tires don't perform well on wet pavement', 'did those stocks perform well last quarter?'

sense.name: do, execute deeds or actions
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] PERFORM NP2 NP1[agent] PERFORM PP[goal]
sense.examples: He performed his daughter's wedding. The children are underperforming on their reading tasks. They perform their duties admirably. The company performed the amazing feat of achieving 22 percent growth last quarter.

sense.name: re-create or re-enact through an artistic medium
sense.examples: They are performing Beethoven's Ninth at Symphony Hall tonight. His plays were underperformed in the 1970s. She couldn't perform the role of Lady McBeth with conviction.
